ExtensionDescription.message: Automatically sync your browsing history to your Windows 10 PC with Windows Timeline. Push active websites to any of your devices.

MicrosoftAccountLogin.message: Sign in with your Microsoft Account

MicrosoftAccountLogout.message: Sign out of your Microsoft Account

MicrosoftAccountLoginAlt1.message: Sign in with the same Microsoft Account as you use on Windows 10.

MicrosoftAccountLoginAlt2.message: After you sign in, your browsing history will be sent to the Windows Timeline and synced across devices.

ProjectRomeOpenOnDevice.message: Open this page on another device

SettingsTimeoutDescription.message: The number of seconds a page must remain open before its included in Windows Timeline.

AboutParagraph1.message: Please Note: Timeline Support is still in development.

AboutParagraph2.message: If you encounter any issues or have any future requests, either tweet (@dominicjmaas) or leave an issue on GitHub.

AboutParagraph3.message: Timeline Support provides deeper Windows 10 integration features into browsers such as Windows Timeline activities and Project Rome.

AboutFeatures1.message: Sync your browsing history to Windows Timeline, access it at a later date or on another device with the same Microsoft Account.

AboutFeatures2.message: Adjust how many seconds you have to be on a page before it's stored in Windows Timeline (by default, 8 seconds).

AboutFeatures3.message: Continue browsing on another device quickly by 'pushing' your current active tab to other devices sharing the same Microsoft Account.
